DOC.brief_summary: Patients with Central Retinal Vein Occlusion will undergo vitrectomy, a small needle of about 71 micron will enter a branch retinal vein and TPA will be injected into the obstracted vein.
DOC.brief_title: Retinal Endo Vascular Surgery for Central Retinal Vein Occlusion
DOC.detailed_description: Patients with Central Retinal Vein Occlusion less than 6 month duration and reduction of vision to 6/21 will go OCT and FANG examinations. Patient will be operated vitrectomy, and a branch retinal vein will be punctured by small needle and rTPA 200mcg/ml will be injected to the vein.
DOC.criteria: crvo less than 6 month Visual Acuity less than 6/21 No prior eye surgery except cataract. Retinal/iris neovascularization
